      A commodity class that helps us navigating through a string by storing our current position.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        @Nonnull
public net.dv8tion.jda.core.utils.tuple.Pair<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> process(@Nonnull
                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String input)
                                                                                                                                           throws CommandProcessingException
        Process the entire input string and return a list of all the arguments and a map with each option and their corresponding arguments.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string to process.
        Returns:
        A list containing the arguments and a map containing the options associated with their arguments.
        Throws:
        CommandProcessingException - When there is a syntax error in the input.

      • processArgument

        public java.lang.String processArgument(@Nonnull
                                        CommandProcessor.Cursor cursor)
                                 throws CommandProcessingException
        Parse a single argument from the current position of the cursor until a separator is reached. Can escape characters and quoted strings. Ex: The underlined strings are those who will be parsed and returned by this method. 
         
 !command an argument "you see ?"
          ^^ ^^^^^^^^  ^^^^^^^^^
        Parameters:
        cursor - The cursor which is set just before the starting point of the argument.
        Returns:
        A string representing the parsed argument.
        Throws:
        CommandProcessingException - If a syntax error is detected.

      • processEscapeCharacter

        public char processEscapeCharacter(@Nonnull
                                   CommandProcessor.Cursor cursor)
                            throws CommandProcessingException
        Just a commodity method that will return the next character regardless of its value or throw an exception if not characters are left in the current cursor. Ex: The underlined characters are those who will be parsed and returned by this method. 
         
 !command "hi i\'m here \!"
                ^        ^
        Parameters:
        cursor - The current cursor starting just before the character to escape.
        Returns:
        A char representing the next character.
        Throws:
        CommandProcessingException - If no characters are left to be escaped.

      • processQuotedString

        public java.lang.String processQuotedString(@Nonnull
                                            CommandProcessor.Cursor cursor)
                                     throws CommandProcessingException
        Parse an argument that is quoted so it can contains spaces. If the quotes are double quotes, the single quotes inside will not be treated as a quoted string, you don't need to escape them. Ex: The underlined strings are those who will be parsed and returned by this method. 
         
 !command hey "how are you ?" 'me' fine "i'm jeff"
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^   ^^        ^^^^^^^^^
        Parameters:
        cursor - The current cursor starting just before the quote.
        Returns:
        A string containing the quoted string
        Throws:
        CommandProcessingException - If the quote isn't closed or if an underlying method throws this exception.

      • processOptions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> processOptions(@Nonnull
                                                                       CommandProcessor.Cursor cursor)
                                                                throws CommandProcessingException
        Process the complete set of options that is provided at the end of the command. When this method is called the rest of the cursor will be consumed and no other arguments are parsed.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The current cursor starting just before the start of the options.
        Returns:
        A map containing the options string and there associated argument.
        Throws:
        CommandProcessingException - If a syntax error is thrown.

      • processLongOption

        public net.dv8tion.jda.core.utils.tuple.Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> processLongOption(@Nonnull
                                                                                                  CommandProcessor.Cursor cursor)
                                                                                           throws CommandProcessingException
        Parse an explicit option starting with two times the option prefix (--) and its argument if found. Ex: The underlined pairs of strings are those who will be parsed and returned by this method. 
         
 !command hey -a nope --force --name "a name"
                        ^^^^^   ^^^^--^^^^^^
        Parameters:
        cursor - The current cursor starting just before the name of the option.
        Returns:
        A pair of two strings, the name of the option and its argument if present.
        Throws:
        CommandProcessingException - If a syntax error is detected.

      • processShortOptions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> processShortOptions(@Nonnull
                                                                            CommandProcessor.Cursor cursor)
                                                                     throws CommandProcessingException
        Parse a short option that is a concatenation of multiple options and the optional argument of the last option. Ex: The underlined pairs of strings are those who will be parsed and returned by this method. 
         
 !command hey -abc name -h "my name jeff" -v --name hi
               ^^^-^^^^  ^--^^^^^^^^^^^^   ^
        Parameters:
        cursor - The current cursor starting just before the first short option.
        Returns:
        A map containing each short option and its argument (but only the last can actually have an argument).
        Throws:
        CommandProcessingException - If a syntax error is reached.
